<rule xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset" id="empty-beans-xml-00001">
            <when>
                <!-- Look for a beans1.xml without any 'beans' element -->
                <and>
                    <file filename="beans.xml"/>
                    <not>
                        <or>
                           <!-- It is common for a beans1.xml file to not include any namespace information or version attribute, 
                               so just look for the beans element name, with or without a namespace prefix -->
                           <xmlfile in="beans.xml" matches="/j:beans">
                               <namespace prefix="j" uri="http://xmlns.jcp.org/xml/ns/javaee"/>
                           </xmlfile>
                           <xmlfile in="beans.xml" matches="/beans">
                           </xmlfile>
                        </or>
                    </not>
                </and>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint category-id="potential" effort="1" title="Use the `all` CDI bean discovery mode if the application has beans without bean defining annotations">
                    <message>Add a `beans` element with a `bean-discovery-mode='all'` attribute to an empty beans.xml file if the application has beans without bean defining annotations </message>
                    <link href="https://access.redhat.com/articles/6980265#cdi_bean_discovery" title="Jakarta Contexts and Dependency Injection Bean Discovery"/>
                    <tag>JakartaEE</tag>
                    <quickfix name="empty-beans-xml-bean-discovery-mode-insert" type="INSERT_LINE">
                        <newline><![CDATA[<beans bean-discovery-mode="all"></beans>]]></newline>
                    </quickfix>
                </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>
